title: Irregular cycle start
vignette: A woman unexpectedly begins bleeding a few days early.

options.text: She counts seven clean days from when the bleeding stops.
Ignore early spotting and follow her usual schedule.

title: Seeing a speck of blood
vignette: A tiny stain the size of a pinhead appears on her garment.

options.text: Any blood renders her a niddah regardless of amount.
Less than a lentil is disregarded as accidental.

title: Borrowed cloth for checking
vignette: She uses a friend's checking cloth when hers is lost.

options.text: Borrowing is fine if the cloth is clean.
Only her own cloth is acceptable for reliability.

title: Husband travels unexpectedly
vignette: Her spouse returns from a trip without notice during her counting days.

options.text: They must maintain separation until the count ends.
Since he surprised her, the count can pause for reunion.

title: Miscarriage confusion
vignette: She experiences a brief discharge but is unsure if it was a miscarriage.

options.text: Treat it as menstrual bleeding and observe niddah.
If uncertain, assume it was not and continue normally.

title: Delayed immersion
vignette: After completing her count, she postpones mikveh due to illness.

options.text: She may delay immersion until healthy without issue.
Delay prolongs impurity; immerse as soon as possible.

title: Shared bed question
vignette: He asks if they can sleep in the same bed without touching during her niddah days.

options.text: Even without touching it is discouraged; use separate beds.
As long as there is no contact, sharing is permitted.

title: Counting days from sunset
vignette: She begins her clean days count right after sunset rather than the next morning.

options.text: Counts start from nightfall; this is correct.
Begin only the next day to avoid doubt.

title: Immersion with jewelry
vignette: She forgot to remove a tight ring before dipping in the mikveh.

options.text: The immersion is valid if water touched all skin.
Any barrier invalidates it; repeat without jewelry.

title: Bridal immersion timing
vignette: A bride's wedding is scheduled before her count finishes.

options.text: Postpone the wedding until immersion is complete.
Hold the ceremony but delay consummation until later.

title: Mid-cycle spotting
vignette: A faint stain appears midway between periods.

options.text: Treat any stain with blood color as niddah.
Ignore stains smaller than a coin if isolated.

title: Using birth control pills
vignette: She considers medication to regulate and shorten her cycles.

options.text: Permissible if supervised by a doctor.
Avoid interfering with the natural cycle.

title: Doubtful color on cloth
vignette: A colored cloth shows a brownish spot that might be old blood.

options.text: If the shade is uncertain, she may disregard it.
Any trace of red hues counts as blood.

title: Overnight pad left unchecked
vignette: She forgets to examine the cloth used overnight until midday.

options.text: Check when remembered and count from the last known time.
Missing a check invalidates the day's count; restart.

title: Scented bath before immersion
vignette: She uses perfumed oil before dipping in the mikveh.

options.text: Oils should be washed off so water contacts the skin.
Minor residue of fragrance does not hinder immersion.
